turns.content: What types of volcanic rock are commonly found in Hawaii?

Hawaiian volcanoes produce mainly two types of lava – basalt and andesite. Basalt is the more common volcanic rock in Hawaii and forms the shield volcanoes that make up the Hawaiian Islands. Andesite is less common and usually associated with more explosive eruptions.
Wow, that's interesting! Do the different types of lava affect how the volcanoes look or behave?

Yes, the different types of lava definitely affect the appearance and behavior of the volcanoes. Basaltic lava, which is more fluid and has lower viscosity, tends to produce broad, gentle shield volcanoes with gently sloping sides. These volcanoes can be quite large and involve extensive flows of lava. Andesitic lava, on the other hand, is more viscous and forms steep-sided, conical volcanoes, such as the ones found on the Big Island of Hawaii. These volcanoes tend to produce explosive eruptions with ash clouds and pyroclastic flows. The type of lava also affects the length of eruptions, with basaltic volcanoes often experiencing long-lasting, effusive eruptions, while andesitic volcanoes tend to have shorter, explosive eruptions.
That's really cool! Have there been any recent eruptions in Hawaii?

Yes, there have been several recent eruptions in Hawaii. The most recent was on May 3, 2018, when the Kilauea volcano on the Big Island of Hawaii began a series of explosive eruptions and fissure outbreaks that lasted until August 2018. These eruptions caused significant damage to nearby communities and resulted in the loss of homes and infrastructure. The Kilauea eruption was one of the most destructive in Hawaii's history.

However, it's important to note that volcanic activity is an ongoing process in Hawaii, as the Hawaiian Islands were formed by volcanic activity and continue to experience occasional eruptions and volcanic activity on different islands. The US Geological Survey's Hawaiian Volcano Observatory monitors volcanic activity in Hawaii and provides regular updates to the public to ensure public safety.
